alert.note: Alert for Tillamook (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 05 at 4:37AM PST until December 05 at 11:38PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Portland OR has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Oregon... Wilson River near Tillamook affecting Tillamook County. Nehalem River near Foss affecting Clatsop and Tillamook Counties. Siletz River at Siletz affecting Lincoln County. Trask River near Tillamook affecting Tillamook County. ...Observed flooding changed from Minor to Major severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Washington... Grays River at Covered Bridge near Rosburg affecting Wahkiakum County. .Widespread rain has caused sudden rises along area rivers and feeding streams. Rain will persist through Wednesday. For the Nw Oregon / Sw Washington Coast...including Willapa, Naselle, Vernonia, Covered Bridge near Rosburg, Foss, Tillamook, Tillamook, Beaver, Siletz, Tidewater, Mapleton...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Trask River near Tillamook. * WHEN...From this afternoon to late this evening. * IMPACTS...Above 16.5 feet, expect minor flooding along the lower Trask River. Dairy farms, buildings, and a few residences adjacent to the Trask in the vicinity of Hwy 101 may be threatened. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:00 AM PST Tuesday the stage was 12.4 feet. - Bankfull stage is 15.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage this afternoon to 17.2 feet late this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late this afternoon to 10.3 feet early Saturday morning. It will rise to 11.5 feet early Sunday morning. It will then fall to 9.4 feet Wednesday, December 13. It will then rise again but remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 16.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 500 PM PST.
